keel.Algorithms.Neural_Networks.RBFN_incremental_CL

Class Rbfn

  • java.lang.Object
    • keel.Algorithms.Neural_Networks.RBFN_incremental_CL.Rbfn

  • public class Rbfn
extends java.lang.Object

    This class codified a Radial Basis Function Network

    Since:
    JDK1.5

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Writen by Antonio J. Rivera Rivas (University of Jaén) 03/03/2004, Modified by Víctor Rivas (University of Jaén) 23/06/2006, Modified by María Dolores Pérez Godoy (University of Jaén) 17/12/2008, Modified by Julian Luengo (University of Granada) 04/02/2013

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rbfn

        public Rbfn()

        Creates a instance of rbnf of fixed structure just for test.

      • Rbfn

        public Rbfn(int numInpt,
            int numOutp)

        Creates a new instance of rbfn

        Parameters:
        numInpt - Input dimension
        numOutp - Ouput dimension (thus, number of ouput neurons)

      • Rbfn

        public Rbfn(double[][] X,
            int ndata,
            int nInpt,
            int nOutp,
            int nNeuro)

        Creates a new instance of rbfn from a matrix of instances. Sets randomly the centres of the neurons and sets its radius taking intro account the maximun distance between centres.

        Parameters:
        X - Matrix of instances
        ndata - Number of instaces in X  @param nInpt Number of imputs of the net
        nInpt - Number of imputs of the net
        nOutp - Number of outputs of the net
        nNeuro - Number of hidden neurons the net will have.

      • Rbfn

        public Rbfn(int nNeuro,
            double[][] X,
            int ndata,
            int nInpt,
            int nOutpl)

        Creates a new instance of rbfn from a matrix of instances. Sets randomly the centres of the neurons and sets its radius taking intro account the average distance between centres.

        Parameters:
        nNeuro - Number of hidden neurons the net will have.
        X - Matrix of instances
        ndata - Number of instaces in X
        nInpt - Number of imputs of the net
        nOutpl - Number of outputs of the net

        Returns:

      • errorRbfn

        public double[] errorRbfn(double[] realOutput,
                          double[] netOutput)

        Computes the difference between the ouput of the net and desired outpunt

        Parameters:
        realOutput - Desired output
        netOutput - Outpunt of the net
        Returns:
        A vector of doubles with the difference between the output of the net and the desired output

        Returns:

      • RAN

        public void RAN(double[][] X,
                double[][] Y,
                int ndata,
                double delta,
                double epsilon,
                double alfa)

        Uses RAN algorithm to build a net

        Parameters:
        X - matrix of inputs instances
        Y - matrix of outputs instances
        ndata - Number of instances
        epsilon - minimun error to introduce a new RBF
        delta - minimun distance to introduce a new RBF
        alfa - learning factor when a new unit is not allocated

      • decremental

        public void decremental(double[][] X,
                        double[][] Y,
                        int ndata,
                        double percent,
                        double alfa)

        Uses a decremental algorithm to buid a net. After initializing and training (with LMS) a net with several neurons, the algorithm in the major loop deletes the neurons with the lowest weight and train the net.

        Parameters:
        X - matrix of inputs instances
        Y - matrix of outputs instances
        ndata - Number of instances
        percent - Percent under the average of the weights to delete a neuron
        alfa - Learnig factor of LMS algorithm

      • trainLMS

        public void trainLMS(double[][] X,
                     double[][] Y,
                     int ndata,
                     int iter,
                     double alfa)

        Uses LMS to train the net.

        Parameters:
        X - matrix of inputs instances
        Y - matrix of outputs instances
        ndata - Number of instances
        iter - Number of times the set of samples will be used.
        alfa - Learning factor.

      • testModeling

        public void testModeling(double[][] X,
                         int ndata,
                         double[] obtained)

        Evaluates the net for modeling problem

        Parameters:
        X - matrix of inputs instances
        ndata - Number of instances
        obtained - Vector of results of the evaluation
